quote: You have power over your mind-not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. - Marcus Aurelius
The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts. - Marcus Aurelius
Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one. - Marcus Aurelius
If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself but to your estimate of it. - Marcus Aurelius
Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them. - Marcus Aurelius
The best revenge is not to be like your enemy. - Marcus Aurelius
It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live. - Marcus Aurelius
A man's worth is no greater than the worth of his ambitions. - Marcus Aurelius
Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth. - Marcus Aurelius
Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life. - Marcus Aurelius
He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive. - Seneca
We suffer more often in imagination than in reality. - Seneca
Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body. - Seneca
It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it. - Seneca
Associate with people who are likely to improve you. - Seneca
The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately. - Seneca
Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms-you'll be able to use them better when you're older. - Seneca
A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials. - Seneca
What progress, you ask, have I made? I have begun to be a friend to myself. - Seneca
It does not matter how many books you have, but how good the books are. - Seneca
Man conquers the world by conquering himself. - Zeno of Citium
Happiness is a good flow of life. - Zeno of Citium
Steel your sensibilities, so that life shall hurt you as little as possible. - Zeno of Citium
Well-being is attained by little and little, and nevertheless is no little thing itself. - Zeno of Citium
A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason, and against nature. - Zeno of Citium
No loss should be more regrettable to us than losing our time, for it's irretrievable. - Zeno of Citium
We have two ears and one mouth, so we should listen more than we say. - Zeno of Citium
Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue. - Zeno of Citium
Fortune bids me to follow philosophy with fewer encumbrances. - Zeno of Citium
The goal of life is living in agreement with nature. - Zeno of Citium
No man is free who is not master of himself. - Epictetus
It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters. - Epictetus
Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control. - Epictetus
Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants. - Epictetus
First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do. - Epictetus
Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it. - Epictetus
He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at. - Epictetus
Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself. - Epictetus
Only the educated are free. - Epictetus
A wise man is he who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has. - Epictetus
The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge. - Stephen Hawking
A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer. - Bruce Lee
It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society. - Jiddu Krishnamurti
Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one. - Voltaire
He who opens a school door, closes a prison. - Victor Hugo
Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers. - Voltaire
An investment in knowledge pays the best interest. - Benjamin Franklin
If you wish to see the truth, then hold no opinion for or against anything. - Osho
A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool. - William Shakespeare
You must do the thing you think you cannot do. - Eleanor Roosevelt
Do not pray for an easy life; pray for the strength to endure a difficult one. - Bruce Lee
Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life. - J.K. Rowling
When you come out of the storm, you won't be the same person who walked in. That's what the storm is all about. - Haruki Murakami
It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves. - Edmund Hillary
What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men. - Seneca
The wound is the place where the light enters you. - Rumi
You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore. - William Faulkner
A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does. - Dan Millman
The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself. - Plato
Small disciplines repeated with consistency lead to great achievements. - John C. Maxwell
Do what you can, with what you have, where you are. - Theodore Roosevelt
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop. - Confucius
Self-control is strength. Right thought is mastery. Calmness is power. - James Allen
Freedom is the will to be responsible for oneself. - Friedrich Nietzsche
We do not rise to the level of our expectations, we fall to the level of our training. - Archilochus
If you are not willing to risk the usual, you will have to settle for the ordinary. - Jim Rohn
The chains of habit are too weak to be felt until they are too strong to be broken. - Samuel Johnson
Courage isn't having the strength to go on-it is going on when you don't have strength. - Napoleon Bonaparte
Opportunities multiply as they are seized. - Sun Tzu
When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor. - Elon Musk
Never let success get to your head and never let failure get to your heart. - Anonymous
Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat. - Sun Tzu
The secret of getting ahead is getting started. - Mark Twain
Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit. - Napoleon Hill
Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow. - Robert Kiyosaki
Victory belongs to the most persevering. - Napoleon Bonaparte
Don't let yesterday take up too much of today. - Will Rogers
A goal without a plan is just a wish. - Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
If you want something you've never had, you must be willing to do something you've never done. - Thomas Jefferson
Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly. - Robert F. Kennedy
Security is mostly a superstition. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing. - Helen Keller
Be fearless in the pursuit of what sets your soul on fire. - Jennifer Lee
It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult. - Seneca
Take risks: If you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise. - Anonymous
If you're not prepared to be wrong, you'll never come up with anything original. - Ken Robinson
A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for. - John A. Shedd
He who has a why to live can bear almost any how. - Friedrich Nietzsche
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear-not absence of fear. - Mark Twain
Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth. - Henry David Thoreau
To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time. - Abraham Lincoln
You can evade reality, but you cannot evade the consequences of evading reality. - Ayn Rand
Integrity is doing the right thing, even when no one is watching. - C.S. Lewis
What you do today is important because you are exchanging a day of your life for it. - Unknown
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones. - Confucius
Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens. - Jimi Hendrix
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together. - African Proverb
In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity. - Albert Einstein
To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often. - Winston Churchill
You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him find it within himself. - Galileo Galilei
No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell. - Carl Jung
He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life. - Muhammad Ali
Pain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever. - Lance Armstrong
Do what you fear and the death of fear is certain. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get. - Dale Carnegie
Everything you want is on the other side of fear. - Jack Canfield
Hard choices, easy life. Easy choices, hard life. - Jerzy Gregorek
The mind is everything. What you think, you become. - Buddha
Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Wealth is the ability to fully experience life. - Henry David Thoreau
Fear is the mind-killer. - Frank Herbert, Dune
The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself. - Jordan Belfort
The best way out is always through. - Robert Frost
Make your life a masterpiece; imagine no limitations on what you can be, have, or do. - Brian Tracy
Nothing ever goes away until it teaches us what we need to know. - Pema Chödrön
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit. - Aristotle
A man cannot remake himself without suffering, for he is both the marble and the sculptor. - Alexis Carrel
To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities. - Bruce Lee
When you stop chasing the wrong things, you give the right things a chance to catch you. - Lolly Daskal
Beware of the person of one book. - Thomas Aquinas
A hungry stomach, an empty pocket, and a broken heart teach you the best lessons in life. - Unknown
In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take. - Lewis Carroll
Tough times never last, but tough people do. - Robert H. Schuller
Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power. - Lao Tzu
If you don't stand for something, you will fall for anything. - Malcolm X
The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus. - Bruce Lee
There are two rules for success: 1. Never tell everything you know. - Roger H. Lincoln
Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. - Steve Jobs
You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do. - Henry Ford
No man has a right to be an amateur in the matter of physical training. - Socrates
Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe. - Abraham Lincoln
The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places. - Ernest Hemingway
If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything. - Mark Twain
People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures. - F.M. Alexander
Maturity is achieved when a person accepts life as full of tension. - Joshua Loth Liebman
I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become. - Carl Jung
Adversity introduces a man to himself. - Albert Einstein
The best way to predict the future is to create it. - Peter Drucker
Your character is your fate. - Heraclitus
Worrying does not empty tomorrow of its troubles; it empties today of its strength. - Corrie Ten Boom
He who has learned to disagree without being disagreeable has discovered the most valuable secret of diplomacy. - Robert Estabrook
The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness. - Lao Tzu
Everything is hard before it is easy. - Goethe
We do not rise to the level of our expectations, we fall to the level of our training. - Archilochus
Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power. - Lao Tzu
The best revenge is massive success. - Frank Sinatra
He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life. - Muhammad Ali
The greatest wealth is to live content with little. - Plato
The mind is everything. What you think, you become. - Buddha
Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out. - Robert Collier
A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes. - Mahatma Gandhi
Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans. - John Lennon
Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. - Steve Jobs
It is never too late to be what you might have been. - George Eliot
The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
You must be the change you wish to see in the world. - Mahatma Gandhi
In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on. - Robert Frost
Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils. - Louis Hector Berlioz
What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals. - Zig Ziglar
I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work. - Thomas Edison
No one can make you feel inferior without your consent. - Eleanor Roosevelt
The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step. - Lao Tzu
The only impossible journey is the one you never begin. - Tony Robbins
You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated. - Maya Angelou
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
Success is not in what you have, but who you are. - Bo Bennett
It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up. - Vince Lombardi
Believe you can and you're halfway there. - Theodore Roosevelt
You must do the thing you think you cannot do. - Eleanor Roosevelt
Don't count the days, make the days count. - Muhammad Ali
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop. - Confucius
A goal without a plan is just a wish. - Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Hard times may have held you down, but they are also what will shape you. - Anonymous
The man who has confidence in himself gains the confidence of others. - Hasidic Proverb
You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore. - William Faulkner
What we think, we become. - Buddha
The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty. - Winston Churchill
Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad. - Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
He who has a why to live can bear almost any how. - Friedrich Nietzsche
The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall. - Nelson Mandela
It always seems impossible until it's done. - Nelson Mandela
The only thing we have to fear is fear itself. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
Courage is grace under pressure. - Ernest Hemingway
It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves. - Sir Edmund Hillary
Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear. - George Addair
In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take. - Lewis Carroll
If you don't stand for something, you'll fall for anything. - Malcolm X
Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person. - Mother Teresa
Whatever you are, be a good one. - Abraham Lincoln
Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated. - Confucius
Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does. - William James
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. - Amelia Earhart
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit. - Aristotle
There are no shortcuts to any place worth going. - Beverly Sills
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. - Eleanor Roosevelt
It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters. - Epictetus
Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. - Sam Levenson
The best way out is always through. - Robert Frost
A ship is always safe at shore but that is not what it's built for. - Albert Einstein
Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass, it's about learning to dance in the rain. - Anonymous
It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up. - Vince Lombardi
Challenges are what make life interesting; overcoming them is what makes life meaningful. - Joshua Marine
To succeed in life, you need two things: ignorance and confidence. - Mark Twain
The key to success is to focus on goals, not obstacles. - Unknown
Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment. - Buddha
Do one thing every day that scares you. - Eleanor Roosevelt
The future belongs to those who prepare for it today. - Malcolm X
Life isn't about finding yourself. It's about creating yourself. - George Bernard Shaw
Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it. - Charles R. Swindoll

Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds. - Orison Swett Marden
Do what you can, where you are, with what you have. - Theodore Roosevelt
Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough. - Og Mandino
Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. - Henry David Thoreau
Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does. - William James
In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity. - Albert Einstein
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together. - African Proverb
The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter. - Martin Luther King Jr.
It is not what we get, but who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives. - Tony Robbins
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing. - Socrates
You can never plan the future by the past. - Edmund Burke
Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations. - Oliver Goldsmith
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones. - Confucius
Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another. - Walter Elliot
We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them. - Albert Einstein
You miss 100% of the shots you don't take. - Wayne Gretzky
